column2: sasmom98, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I am a 40 year old female with minor asthma and otherwise healthy.  I was vaccinated with pneumovax 23 5 1/2 years ago and then re-vaccinated yesterday.  The pain I am feeling today is 10 times worse than the original vaccination pain 5 years ago.  I needed help dressing and could not sleep more than an hour at a time the first night.  Even piggybacking ibuprofin and acetaminaphin every 4 hours is offering little relief.  Now on day two I am running a fever of 101 F and I am extremely exhaused and a touch nauseated.  Yuck!  This second round is nothing like the first one was.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Allergist prescribed this due to me having 6 sinus infections within the last 7 months.  Some were so severe I had to take steroids in addition to antibiotics.  I wish the pharmacist had given me the drug information.  Got it on a Wednesday at 6pm.  It is now Saturday 4:30pm and I still feel terrible.  24 hours after the injection my right arm hurt so badly I could not sleep, wash my hair, dress myself, and was in tears.  This was not the normal pain you may be in after a vaccination.  The pain radiated up to my shoulder and down to my elbow.  I've been running a fever, feel achy all over, have a throbbing headache, and am basically miserable.  I would not have gotten the vaccine had I known I would feel this bad afterwards.  I don't know how much longer this is going to last.  I may get someone to drive me to an Urgent Care office in a few hours.

column2: getting better, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Since relocating to the midwest in 2008, I have had recurrent sinus infections 5-6+ per year. This is a last resort. So far its been working fine for me. Usually when I got ot town, I get ill there and return home heading straight for my dr's office...Not this time. Took it last Thursday went out of town the same day and haven't had any issues. Returned home now and still doing great.

column2: Observer, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm a 41 yr old female...My allergist recommended Pneumovax due to low immunity count in a bloodwork test...I get frequent sinus infections and this vaccine has been used for that purpose also.Got the vaccine yesterday 04-02-12.  There is a bit of redness and tenderness at the site of injection.  It only hurts when I touch it, other than that, my arm feels fine.I did sleep a lot today but no fever.  Had a bad headache this morning but no other symptoms to report.  This is only day 2, so I guess we'll see...so far, everything seems ok..

column2: dd, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Had the injection 2 days ago.  Arm very sore first day.  Today woke w/ red blotches near the inj. site, and still sore. Hope that's all. Advice: Do NOT get this inj. in your dominant arm!

column2: Thankful, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this injection since age 26 and I am now 41.  I've never exprienced and problems with the vaccine. I need this to live my daily life as I do not have a spleen and can't fight infections as some can.  However I also know exactly when this vaccine is wearing off and it becomes time for me to receive my next injection as every month I get very sick.  In reading the first few reviews, my heart goes out to those that expirenced paid behind taking the injection. As for me I'd rather experience that pain for a few days then catch pneumonia and can't fight it due to a compromised immune system.  Thanks for allowing me to voice my opinion on this injection.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Had my pneumovax injection yesterday and today my are is red from just below the deltoid muscle to my elbow,swollen, hard,warm to touch and painful(but not bad. PA put me on zithromax and prednisone. I had no problem with the first injection six years ago, but I will not take it again. My first injection was given intramuscularly and this one was given subcutaneously.  I don't know it that made the difference or what.

column2: suesue, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: Brother in law received this vaccine.  Within a week he was in the ER, eventually spent 10 1/5 months in hospital/rehab, 4 months on ventilator.  Guillain Barre Syndrome.  He is in a wheelchair with crippled hands.  Would NEVER take!!

column2: sandy, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My doctor recommended I have pneumovax at my yearly physical for first time. Entire upper arm sore to touch two days after. Had chills and extreme dry mouth for two days. Probably would not have again.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Got the shot on Wednesday and I still can't move my arm 3 days later.  Pain is excruciating!  Maybe they need to mix xylocaine in with this vaccination, this is more painful than Rocephin!

column2: PamW, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am a 65-year-old woman in general good health.  My doctor recommended this preventive vaccine during my annual check up yesterday.  Within 2 hours I experienced enough pain at the site (upper right arm) to make driving very difficult.  Sleepless all night because of excruciating pain.  Unable to dress myself or do any activity which requires me to raise my arm.  Tylenol and Advil don't touch the pain.  When my doctor's office opens this morning I will have a neighbor drive me to get something to make the pain more manageable.  Cannot sleep or rest.  Cannot drive.  Cannot work.  I have never had a reaction to a vaccine before.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given this shot because my bloodwork came back as having a low immune system. I'm always having sinus infections, so my ENT doctors recommened this shot. I didn't have any pain on day 1. The middle of the night is when I started to expirence the pain in the arm. Horrible pain, couldn't touch it, couldn't raise my arm to do anything. Day 3 I have reddness and some swelling, it's hot. This is no where near the shot site, it's under my arm, I don't know if this is normal or not. I also have chills. I would never get this shot again.

column2: Sandy, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am a 71 yr old female in excellent health; had this 'booster' following annual physical yesterday, to prevent possible pneumonia.  Within one hour after injection in upper left arm, site of shot became hot, red and swollen.  Swelling spread to nearly elbow, and, site became hard. Called MD office immediately on noting symptoms, and they recommended:  Tylenol, ice the arm, elevate it.  Did all that, helped the pain somewhat. Pain is still pretty severe on this the second day.  Called nurse at MD office today; she said 'sometimes people have bad reaction' and MD will call back this afternoon.  I want to get this info on the record.I am grateful to read others' experience, it helps to know that mine is not particularly an abnormal reaction, but I surely feel sorry for all of us who have had this kind of pain.  Also, grading an immunization by using the stars is not an entirely accurate method of judging this drug.  I don't know if it will be effective or not.  God knows I hope so, after the discomfort!This has been most unpleasant, and I did NOT have this kind of reaction with the intial shot five years ago; at that time, I just felt a general malaise as it is termed.  This arm pain feels as though I have pitched 40 games in a row...

column2: DHeinsohn, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Had annual physical 01-13-10, and felt great. As precaution for overseas travel took Pneumo-23 in right arm, and varicella in left. By afternoon right arm hurt, was hot, and changing color. Next afternoon had 103.4 fever. Arm hurt from elbow to shoulder. Also red color for most of upper arm. Laid up in bed for next 3 days with ice packs on head. Two days of 103.4, and one day of 101 fever. Naturally this occured over a weekend. Went in to clinic Monday morning and started an antibiotic. Likely the sickest I have been as an adult. The previous 3 years I had not been ill with anything. I normally don't take any medications. I am in generally good health, low blood pressure. Scared the bee gees out of me. I wonder if with the high fever either vaccine was effective. I sure won't take it again. Maybe not any vaccine.

column2: Rbt, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Had vacc 12 hrs ago in L arm, no discomfort for first 8 hrs. Since then, my arm has been increasingly irritated, swelling increased to width of arm, not just injection site. Hot to touch, irritated, itchy, tender to touch, not discolored.

column2: mjohnson, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am in my mid-50's, have a congenital heart defect.  I had my first pneumovax in 2003 and I have not had one bout of pneumonia since!  I used to get pneumonia 2-3 times per year.  I just received another vaccine yesterday and my arm is extremely painful and swollen - my entire arm all the way down into my hand and fingers.  Warm compress has helped a bit.

column2: Jack, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had the shot Oct 2. 4 days later my left arm pit lymphnode swelled followed by a lymph node in my cheek.  Then the shot site hurt.  Dr gave me Doxycyline. Following day my left calf and quad muscles starting getting tight.  I reported the change in symptons.  Next day could not walk due to both leg muscles being too tight. Went to ER. They gave me steroids and reported body inflamation being 2x and white cell count being high. Steroids took care of symptons, muscle relaxers took care of muscles.  However the steroids gave me a yeast infection and I am male!!  This is a terrible vaccine.  I only recommend it to my enemies.  Merck should be ashamed of themselves.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had extreme pain and swelling in my arm to the point I couldn't move it or use it to lift anything and woke up several times throughout the night in extreme pain that couldn't even be relieved by opiate pain meds. I iced it, I tried hot compresses, nothing helped.  I also had a 101 fever from the vaccine. It has been 3 days and I'm still in severe pain but the fever is gone at least. Hopefully this horrible vaccine will at least prevent pneumonia!

column2: Cobra, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Extreme Pain swelling in the arm inabilityto move right arm, injection site, inabilityto sleep, Feels like someone ripped the boneout of the socket, Fever and Nausea nevertake the medicine again

column2: Bleck, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The day after the injection my arm is still sore, and I begin running a fever, nausea, vomiting and slept for over 24 hours straight. Bruising easily day 3. Still sick with fever/nausea day 4. Sure hope it keeps me from getting pneumonia and makes it worth all this.

column2: 65-74 Female  (Patient)
column9: Three days after I had a pneumovax injection, I began having a very strange symptom every night in bed, before going to sleep. Every minute or so, as I'm lying there, I feel a sudden jolt, much like an electric shock, that feels like it makes an arc through the middle of my brain. It lasts only about a second and strikes every minute or so, until I fall asleep. I've now had this symptom every night for 10 nights. I googled "brain zap" and found many descriptions of this symptom but almost all of them written by people trying to wean themselves off antidepressants. I've never taken antidepressants and don't take any drugs other than an occasional aspirin. I'm a very healthy 68 year old woman. I've never experienced anything like this before and it came on suddenly and with intensity.

column2: vc293,  Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Received shot on 8/26/09, Severe arm pain on night one. Develop a fever on day two 100-102, day three fever went to 103+, went back to doctor and my heart went into a-fib. Spent the day at the hospital. Now I'm on a lifetime heart drug. Day four fever finally broke. I a 49 year old male in great health and this is the first fever I've had in 15 years. I will never get a prevented shot for anything.

column2: SUQI-SOO, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: WHETHER THIS VACCINE IS EFFECTIVE OR NOT I HAVE NO IDEA.  I RECEIVED THE INJECTION O8-25-09. NO PROBLEM WITH PROCESS OF INJECTION. NO PAIN UNTIL ABOUT SIX HOURS LATER.  INTENSE ACHE INTERFERRING WITH SLEEP; CANNOT LAY ON MY LEFT SIDE WITHOUT AGGRAVATING PAIN DOWN TO ELBOW. DAY TWO ALSO INCLUDED A HEADACHE. DAY THREE ADDS NAUSEA AND HOT EYES, PAIN  IN BUTTOCKS. NOT LOOKING FORWARD TO DAY FOUR.

column2: stott602@hotmail.com, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: On April 27, 2006 my husband a heart patient received this shot for the first time. About a week later he got a cold from it and on May 17,2006 he died. I don't know if it was from the shot or his heart.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Havent had a cold or sinus infection in 5 years since taking it... Including flu. Might have been unable to fight it off with a constant sinus infection. Now clear as a bell and that includes the winter when everyone else is sick.

column2: charles, 45-54 Male  (Caregiver)
column9: May 3, 2007 my 10 month old son received three vaccines. One injection intended for the right thigh caused the needle to shoot off the syringe and the vaccine sprayed me and the clinic wall and floor. Seven weeks later the right femur could not support his weight, and he continued to cry the next morning. To cut a long story short, the surgeon who investigated the bone said it was the consistency of cheese. full leg cast for 3 months, two surgical investigations, CT and NMR scans, no evidence of microbe histopathologically although one culture grew (common) microbe found in mouth. Unclear which vaccine was injected into the periosteum and box not checked on vaccination card for whether it was PCV or PPV23 nor for the previous pneumococcal vaccination. Doctor told me nurse was let go on a later visit. Neither the surgeon, nor the clinical immunologist believed he experiences a microbial infection. I suspect my sons 3rd pneumoccocal vaccination was probably the 23valent and it caused a massive inflammatory reaction in the periosteum which spread to the femur.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Started with managable pain and swelling at the site but day two brought severe pain that was made worse by touch and stiffness. The pain had spread from a site reaction up my arm to the shoulder and down to the elbow. Day three has also included nausea, vomiting, and low fever. Ibuprofen has helped only slightly to reduce the pain.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Pain at the injection site was manageable with massage & Ibuprophen. You must massage the injection site 4-5 times in the first 24 hours after injection. This minimizes the amount of medication left in the arm, and helps 100% with the swelling. I've had 3 of these shots in the last 14 years, all with the same effect. I'll continue to use it as long as I can.

column2: nms, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have now had two of these vaccinations. Injection site became quite painful about 6 hours later, interferring with sleep, dressing, and my generally sunny mood. My upper arm is quite swollen and movement is limited, but I have no other side effects. Ibuprofen helps a little, as does a cold compress.

column2: ghbaldwin, 65-74 Male  (Patient)
column9: Within 10 hours of administration, I had fever (101), joint and muscle ache, congestion, burning eyes, and soreness to the touch at the injection site.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: Got shot 2 days ago.  Very painful at injectin site.  Have low grade fever, nausea & muscle aches since last night.  Hope it doesnt last much longer!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Have a lot of pain from the injection site. I can hardly move my arm. Have cold chills,nausea, muscle aches, etc...

column2: 19-24 Female
column9: Agreed to try vaccine for a trial study, but pain is horrible. Can't sleep, can barely dress myself, if anything touches my arm even lightly, the pain is unbearable.  I'm also hot, nauseous, and have back/head pain. (day 2)

column2: irkabenjon@aol.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Severe swelling,pain, redness, radiating around upper arm into axilla. Tenderness in axilla. Fever, chills, nausea. Area affected feels hard. Very uncomfortable reaction. This is day two.
